item.title: MicroK8s on Pi 4 8GB (I)
item.description: I recently spent 40 minutes setting up MicroK8s on my new Raspberry Pi 4 Model B 8GB. Opting for a headless install due to a lack of a microHDMI cable, I used Ubuntu Server (64-bit) for the 64-bit requirements of MicroK8s. After initial setup, including changing the hostname and enabling memory cgroup, I installed MicroK8s, ensuring compatibility by adding my user to the MicroK8s group. Verification and usage of MicroK8s followed, with additional steps for enabling services like the dashboard. Troubleshooting involved switching to a 64-bit OS and finding the Pi’s IP using nmap. Excited to explore MicroK8s on my Raspberry Pi!
